statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Jordan Burns poured in 30 points, knocking down 5 of 10 shots from 3-point range, and Colgate picked up its first victory of the year with an 87-74 win over Monmouth on Friday night.
article.headline: Burns scores 30 as Colgate cruises past Monmouth 87-74
article.linkText: Burns scores 30 as Colgate cruises past Monmouth 87-74
article.story: HAMILTON, N.Y. -- Jordan Burns poured in 30 points, knocking down 5 of 10 shots from 3-point range, and Colgate picked up its first victory of the year with an 87-74 win over Monmouth on Friday night. Rapolas Ivanauskas finished with 22 points and 10 rebounds to post his second double-double in as many games for the Raiders (1-1). Colgate nearly shot better from outside the 3-point arc than inside it against the Hawks. The Raiders connected at a 46-percent clip from the floor overall but sank 13 of 29 from distance (45 percent). Will Rayman scored 15 and Burns added six assists and five rebounds. Ray Salnave topped the Hawks (0-2) with 16 points, while Deion Hammond and Louie Pillari scored 14 and 10, respectively. Monmouth shot 39 percent from the floor (22 of 57), but just 33 percent (6 of 18) from distance. Colgate had a 39-32 advantage on the boards for the game and outscored the Hawks 53-39 in the second half.
